fields.physical_description:
The horse is carved in relief from a single thinnish block of limewood and the area below the belly has been simply shaped. However; the horse's stance is different each side-right (offside) front leg is raised and rear leg is straight while on the left (nearside) front leg is straight and rear leg is raised. Tail is only shown on offside. Glued to the horse is the rider; probably a Hussar. The figure has a simply carved front and a flat back and is turned slightly to the right. A N Varganov is a well known and internationally known maker of these toys. His work is represented in other museums in the USA; Australia; Japan and Germany. He comes from a traditional craft family making these types of toys; both wooden and papier maché; from before 1900. 
*There is a registered packet containing additional printed material including the booklet; Russian list and English translation; a newspaper clipping and catalogue of the exhibition.
fields.title: HORSEMAN
fields.marks: AB 1994 (hot poker incised mark) and in pencil BCAGHUK (horseman in Russian lettering)
fields.history_note:
References: RUSSIAN FOLK TOYS booklet published by the Museum of Toys; USSR Academy of Pedagogical Sciences. see also registered packet


Collection was presented to BGM by the Traditional Sergiev Cultures Centre; following an exhibition at the Cambridge Folk Museum; September 1994. The items are modern; made to the traditional designs and methods by craftsmen whose families had produced the toys before 1900.

Price: £20.00
fields.production_note:
Made by: A N Varganov of Sergiev Posad.
Russia
